sentence.Network_en: We  suppose that  you're carving gargoyle up in the corner of this building .
sentence.Network_cn: 我们假设你在雕刻建筑高处的某一角上的滴水嘴怪。

sentence.Network_en: His disfigured face was like some avenging nemesis of gargoyle design.
sentence.Network_cn: 他那张破了相的脸,活象面目狰狞的复仇之神.

sentence.Network_en: His face was the gargoyle of the devil, it was not human , it was not sane.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的脸简直就像魔鬼模样的屋檐滴水嘴.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French gargouille 'throat', also 'gargoyle' (because of the water passing through the throat and mouth of the figure); related to Greek gargarizein 'to gargle' (imitating the sounds made in the throat)

entry.tran: （老式建筑的石雕）怪兽状滴水嘴，滴水兽
entry.def: A gargoyle is a decorative stone carving on old buildings. It is usually shaped like the head of a strange and ugly creature, and water drains through it from the roof of the building.

means.word_mean: 1. a spout that terminates in a grotesquely carved figure of a person or animal
2. an ornament consisting of a grotesquely carved figure of a person or animal
